links.title: Amazon Ion
links.description: Amazon Ion is a richly-typed, self-describing, hierarchical data serialization format offering interchangeable binary and text representations. Ion has been addressing these challenges within Amazon for nearly a decade, and we believe others will benefit as well.

links.title: NestedText: A Human Friendly Data Format â€” NestedText 1.3.1 documentation
links.description:
NestedText is a file format for holding data that is to be entered, edited, or
viewed by people.  It allows data to be organized into a nested collection of
dictionaries, lists, and strings.  In this way it is similar to JSON, YAML
and TOML, but without the complexity and risk of YAML and without the
syntactic clutter of JSON and TOML.  NestedText is both simple and
natural.  Only a small number of concepts and rules must be kept in mind when

links.title: Scope of Variables Â· The Julia Language
links.description: The scope of a variable is the region of code within which a variable is visible. Variable scoping helps avoid variable naming conflicts. The concept is intuitive: two functions can both have arguments called x without the two x's referring to the same thing.
